item.title: Cellular Netbooks Are Downright Cheap
item.description:
Do you spend most of your computing time on the go? If so, a computer designed for mobility might be perfect for you, like one of the new netbooks with built-in 3G cellular internet access. You might be thinking laptops aren’t that bulky and work fine at a coffee shop. That’s true. A laptop with a wireless modem aircard would be comparable to a netbook in functionality. However, laptops are heavier and often carry unnecessary extras...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/cellular-netbooks-are-downright-cheap/

item.title: Is That A Game Or A Netbook?
item.description:
For years, the distinction between computers and video games has been blurry. This is because modern gaming consoles are essentially powerful computers that run games as applications. So it’s no surprise that Nintendo’s latest handheld gaming system, the DSi, boasts netbook-like features such as secure WiFi connectivity, a web browser, and expandable memory. Let’s be clear: the Nintendo DSi is designed for gamers. It’s a handheld console, powered by a battery, and runs Nintendo DS game cartridges...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/is-that-a-game-or-a-netbook/
